slides.templateDescription: Swipe through a gallery of images

images.caption: # Security is not a one-time project.
# It's an attitude, an ethos, laser-focused on protecting each patient's data.
# Although the Security Rule is discusses ePHI (PHI in an electronic format)...
# The restrictions and practices apply to "hard copies", too.

question.content: Security policies and procedures, if well-designed, do not need to be reviewed and updated.

answer.takeaway: The world **changes**, and so do both threats and how an entity should respond to those threats.  It's important that Security practices - including training - keep pace.

data.title: Security policies and procedures, if well-designed, do not need to be reviewed and updated.

slides.templateDescription: Flip cards to reveal more details

content.title: **Confidentiality**
content.description: ## PHI is accessible only by authorized people and processes

content.title: **Integrity**
content.description: ## PHI is not altered or destroyed in an unauthorized manner

content.title: **Availability**
content.description: ## PHI can be accessed as needed by an authorized entity

data.prompt: Select each item to find out more
data.title: **Important definitions according to HHS**

data.label: Step
content: ### Ensure the **confidentiality, integrity,** and **availability** of all electronic protected health information that the covered entity or business associate creates, receives, maintains, or transmits.
### Protect against any reasonably anticipated **threats or hazards** to the security or integrity of such information.
### Protect against any reasonably anticipated **uses or disclosures** of such information that are not permitted or required.
### **Ensure compliance** with the rule by its workforce.
_Source: 45 C.F.R. ยง 164.306(a) - Security standards: General rules_
data.title: **Covered Entities (CE)** must...

question.category: Good security practices protect against any reasonably anticipated threats or hazards to the security or integrity of such information.
Good security practices protect against any reasonably anticipated threats or hazards to the security or integrity of such information.
Good security practices protect against any reasonably anticipated threats or hazards to the security or integrity of such information.

answer.takeaway: HIPAA includes consideration for the reasonableness of both a protection and a threat.  A small practice need not spend $1,000,000 to protect against an improbable or unlikely threat  (e.g., martial law or act of war).  But, HIPAA does expect a comprehensive analysis to distinguish  "reasonable" from "unreasonable" and enact appropriate safeguards.

data.title: Good security practices protect against any reasonably anticipated threats or hazards to the security or integrity of such information.

data.label: Step
content:
# **Risk Analysis** 
## to discover potential unauthorized access and disclosure of PHI

# **Security Analysis** 
## to identify security measures that can be reasonably implemented to address risks identified in the risk analysis
data.title: To determine appropriate safeguards, CE's **should** conduct two analyses:

question.content: What should we do first to implement the HIPAA Security Rule?

answers.content: Change the locks on the doors
Conduct comprehensive risk and security analyses

message.content: What should we do first to implement the HIPAA Security Rule?

answers.correct: Conduct comprehensive risk and security analyses
incorrect: Change the locks on the doors

answer.takeaway: Adequate and appropriate security measures cannot be implemented without understanding the vulnerabilities and threats that risk and security analyses reveal.

slides.templateDescription: Display a long amount of content

data.content:
##
Since no single safeguard is adequate, HIPAA defines three layered, overlapping types of safeguards to protect PHI.

>* ## Administrative Safeguards >* ## Physical Safeguards >* ## Technical Safeguards

(This lesson includes only some of the important specific safeguards. See hhs.gov for a complete list of safeguards for Covered Entities)
data.title: Safeguards to Protect PHI

question.content: The HIPAA Security Rule safeguards include:

answer.takeaway:
HIPAA Security safeguards provide protection against breaches of **patient data**, not the financial data of the entity.  

Implementing the HIPAA safeguards, however, will likely protect the management data of the entity.

data.title: The HIPAA Security Rule safeguards include:
data.subtitle: Select all that apply

slides.templateDescription: Display a list of bullet points

data.prompt: Select an item to see more

list.content:
- Identify and analyze potential risks to PHI 
- Implement security policies, procedures and practices  that reduce risks and vulnerabilities
list.title: ## <center>Security Management Process</center>

list.content: - Designate a Security Officer responsible for security policies, procedures and practices
list.title: ## <center>Security Personnel</center>

list.content: - Create, publish and apply security policies and procedures appropriate for each user's title/function (role-based access)
list.title: ## <center>Information Access Management</center>

list.content:
- Review, authorize and supervise users who work with PHI
- Train all workforce members on security policies, procedures and practices
- Reprimand, restrict and counsel workforce members who violate policies and procedures
list.title: ## <center>Workforce Training and Management</center>

list.content: - Regularly review how security practices implement Security Rule
list.title: ## <center>Evaluation</center>

data.title: Administrative Safeguards

answers.content: Identify and analyze potential risks to PHI
Designate a security officer responsible for security
Implement security policies and procedures using role-based access
Train all workforce members on security policies and procedures
Regularly review how security practices implement Security Rule
Keep facilities locked when no one is present.
Identify and analyze potential risks to PHI
Designate a security officer responsible for security
Implement security policies and procedures using role-based access
Train all workforce members on security policies and procedures
Regularly review how security practices implement Security Rule
Keep facilities locked when no one is present.

answer.takeaway: Administrative safeguards address the human and organizational factors that affect the privacy of patient data and how "wetware" is a key part of the safeguard mosaic that includes separate Physical and Technical safeguards..

slides.templateDescription: Display a list of bullet points

data.prompt: Select an item to see more

list.content: - limit physical access to building or room while permitting authorized access
list.title: ## <center>Facility Access and Control</center>

list.content: - define and and ensure processes for permitted, authorized access to workstations and electronic policies and procedures for all uses of electronic media
list.title: ## <center>Workstation and Device Security</center>

data.title: **Physical Safeguards**

slides.templateDescription: Display a list of bullet points

data.prompt: Select an item to see more

list.content: - create and enforce technical policies and procedures so only authorized persons access PHI
list.title: ## <center>Access Control</center>

list.content: - create and enforce mechanisms (e.g., hardware, software, processes) to control and monitor PHI access and use
list.title: ## <center>Audit Controls</center>

list.content: - create and enforce mechanisms (e.g., policies, processes, electronic methods), to prevent improper changes to or deletions of PHI
list.title: ## <center>Integrity Controls</center>

list.content: - create and enforce mechanisms (e.g., policies, processes, electronic methods) against unauthorized access to PHI transmitted over electronic networks
list.title: ## <center>Transmission Security</center>

data.title: **Technical Safeguards**

question.category: The HIPAA Audit Controls require CE's to conduct semi-annual financial reviews.
question.content: Is the following statement true or false?

data.buttonText: The HIPAA Audit Controls require CE's to conduct semi-annual financial reviews.

answer.takeaway: HIPAA  does not address financial reviews.  But, it's a good idea to regularly review all of the HIPAA covered threats, vulnerabilities and safeguards .

data.title: Is the following statement true or false?

That's it, this lesson is finished.

Strong safeguards require rigorous risk and security analyses to identify threats and vulnerabilities that require safeguards.
